page.title: 17VILLAGE LIFE FINSTOCK - I
page.content: We visited c.{l00 houses }in the west- ern 3rd of {Finstock }and questioned { {44} on{status, length of residence, {age of house, transport}. These facts emerged about {rural Oxon village life : Of {129 people}, 25 were retired, 38 worked in 15 mile radius, 8 further away, 2 unemployed, 38 children, 8 housewives. 29 {households} had lived in the area always; 11 under l0 yrs.{ {Housing} - cottages, farmhouses and bungalows divides as 17 over 100yrs old, 17 less than 25yrs.{ {Transport }mainly private car - 4 households had none and 20 more than 1 vehicle. Occasional use only made of buses and trains as schedules rather limited. Private transport roster to Dr. and Chemist in Charlbury.{ {Education:}Most children at Finstock Primary, others in Witney and Chipping Norton Secondary schools.
